item.description:
Interested in seeing how hummus and tabbouleh get made on a really LARGE scale? We've scored a rare opportunity to go inside a modern food factory: Cedar's Mediterranean Foods. The facility is near Lawrence. The tour should last about an hour to an hour and a half.

We might end up realizing that it's better to make our own hummus, or we might all become lifelong Cedar's customers -- who knows! Either way, we'll get a chance to see how they create this vegan staple and maybe even score some free samples.

Please arrive promptly at 10am. We will wait for 5 minutes and then start the tour!


  • All attendees must wear sneakers (no sandals!).
  • Bring a jacket or sweater.
  • Don't wear jewelry.
  • Sorry, no children under age 18 allowed in facility.
  • Bags will need to be left behind and not brought on the tour.


Afterwards, those who would like to continue on to Life Alive in Lowell for lunch are welcome to do so. Life Alive's menu is here: http://www.lifealive....

PLEASE carpool if you can. I've set up a group page at http://www.pickuppal....
You will need to register. The "secret code" for joining the VMWN group is "carpool".
item.how_to_find_us: We will meet at the front desk.
item.name: Tour of the Cedar's Mediterranean Foods Facility + Lunch at Life Alive
